CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 11, 1950, pg. 6, reads: "KORONATION BENEFIT KONTESTANTS - Pictured above are the competitors for "Kolesque King and Queen" title. Those who attend the Koronation party at Ammon Recreation Center on March 11 will select the winners by their votes.  The affair is for the benefit of the David Children's Home.  The contestants are, top row: Pat Lackett. Second row: Ike Davis.  Third row: John Van Holt, Beryle Boyce, Stanley Rideout.  Fourth row: Germaine Lee, Virginia Tinker, and fifth row: Cleo Peters. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of four young women, including Cleo Peters in front, Germaine Lee wearing multiple strand necklace, Beryl Boyce, and Virginia Tinker on left, and five young men including John Van Holt wearing bow tie on left, Ike Davis, Pat Lackett in center, and two other men including Stanley Rideout, posed on steps of brick building, street no. 7431, for Kolesque Club King and Queen competition, another version
